result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Armoni Javar Lasley

defendant.name: Lasley, Armoni Javar
defendant.address: N2488 Phyllis Wheatly Dr, Burlington, WI 53105

records.addlTxt: Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

DEFENDANT MUST POST $500 CASH AND BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY ARNOLD LASLEY. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH EVAN OBERMEYER. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Called at 1:40 PM. Defendant Armoni Javar Lasley in court, in custody by video. Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman for defendant. Matter before court as weekend lock up. Record by State who asks that bond remain. Record by Attorney Hagerman who asks for signature bond but can post $500 if needed. Defendant's father present and makes statement to the Court. Father is willing to co-sign.  Surety bond set with $500 cash component to be co-signed by Arnold Lasley. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

The original document was titled: Notice of arrest
The original history event date is: 10-17-2022
Signed bond filed with the court.

*see new bond set 10/18/2022*
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
2:35 PM case called. Defendant Armoni Javar Lasley not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant to issue. Minutes filed.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
